You have added a lot of unrelated files here - if you do a `git pull upstream dev` it should fix most of them. It's best not to track all files - i.e. don't do `git add .` to avoid this in future. Just track the files you need - `git add ./examples/js/controls/EarthControls.js`

Going over the files in your zip, your earth controls are basically a copy of OrbitControls with the static Y-UP from #12564 implemented and a couple of other things related to earth size added. I would prefer to just add the option to preserver Y-UP to the current controls as suggested in that PR. 

On the other hand though, the question of how to create a basic scene with a planet and a camera that rotates around it is a very common one and is used in many tutorials. I think it would be a good idea to change the  [misc_controls_orbit](https://threejs.org/examples/?q=orbit#misc_controls_orbit) to show a planet rather than the current (ugly) cloud of triangles. 

EDIT: Just noticed that the [misc_controls_fly](https://threejs.org/examples/misc_controls_fly) already has a nice globe - could we change the Orbit and Trackball controls (which both use the triangle field) to use this as well? It would help to illustrate the differences between the control types if they all use the same scene.

Hi Lewy,

   Thank you for your reply.
   I do not understand what you say about "git add ." That is not the way I use git.

   I agree with the idea of adapting OrbitControls for planet navigation. However, what I did to have nice rotation around the sphere is a little tricky: I make rotate the sphere around its center rather than moving the camera around the planet. I do not know if it is acceptable, but it simplify a lot all process when going further with all other features (tiles, building position, ground elevation, etc...).

   So, I can suggest you an OrbitControls modification, but I think it will complexify existing code.

   Mrdood, an advice?

Clement.
